verses.kjv: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
verses.ct: Listen, my people, to my instruction; pay attention to what I have to say.

verses.kjv: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:
verses.ct: I will speak using stories with deeper meaning; I will share ancient mysteries.

verses.kjv: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
verses.ct: These are things we have heard and understood, things our ancestors passed down to us.

verses.kjv: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.
verses.ct: We won't keep them hidden from the next generation. We will tell our children about the LORD's praiseworthy acts, his power, and the amazing things he has done.

verses.kjv: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:
verses.ct: He set up a standard in Jacob and established a law in Israel, which he commanded our ancestors to teach to their children,

verses.kjv: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:
verses.ct: so that future generations would learn them — even children not yet born — and they in turn would rise up and pass them on to their own children.

verses.kjv: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:
verses.ct: Then they would place their confidence in God, never forget what God had done, and obey his commands.

verses.kjv: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.
verses.ct: They would not end up like their ancestors — a stubborn and defiant generation whose hearts were not committed and whose spirits were not faithful to God.

verses.kjv: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.
verses.ct: The people of Ephraim, though armed with bows, retreated on the day of battle.

verses.kjv: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;
verses.ct: They did not honor God's covenant and refused to follow his law.

verses.kjv: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.
verses.ct: They forgot what he had done — the miracles he had shown them.

verses.kjv: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
verses.ct: He performed incredible things in front of their ancestors in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.

verses.kjv: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.
verses.ct: He split the sea and brought them through it, making the water stand up like walls.

verses.kjv: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.
verses.ct: During the day he guided them with a cloud, and all through the night with a glowing fire.

verses.kjv: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.
verses.ct: He cracked open rocks in the wilderness and gave them water to drink as if from deep underground springs.

verses.kjv: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.
verses.ct: He made streams pour from the rock, causing water to flow down like rivers.

verses.kjv: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.
verses.ct: Yet they kept on sinning against him, defying the Most High in the desert.

verses.kjv: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.
verses.ct: They tested God in their hearts by demanding the food they craved.

verses.kjv: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
verses.ct: They spoke against God, saying, 'Can God really set a table for us out here in the wilderness?'

verses.kjv: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?
verses.ct: 'Sure, he struck the rock and water came gushing out in overflowing streams — but can he also give us bread? Can he supply meat for his people?'

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;
verses.ct: When the LORD heard this, he was angry. His fury blazed against Jacob, and his anger rose against Israel,

verses.kjv: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:
verses.ct: because they did not trust in God or rely on his salvation.

verses.kjv: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,
verses.ct: Yet he had given orders to the clouds above and opened the doors of heaven.

verses.kjv: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.
verses.ct: He had rained down manna for them to eat and given them grain from heaven.

verses.kjv: Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.
verses.ct: People ate the food of angels; he sent them all the provisions they could want.

verses.kjv: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.
verses.ct: He unleashed the east wind from the heavens and drove in the south wind by his power.

verses.kjv: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:
verses.ct: He rained down meat on them like dust — birds as numerous as the sand on the seashore.

verses.kjv: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.
verses.ct: He made them fall right in the middle of their camp, all around their dwellings.

verses.kjv: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;
verses.ct: So they ate and were completely satisfied, because he gave them exactly what they wanted.

verses.kjv: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,
verses.ct: But before they had even finished satisfying their craving, while the food was still in their mouths,

verses.kjv: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
verses.ct: God's anger erupted against them. He killed the strongest among them and struck down Israel's finest young men.

verses.kjv: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.
verses.ct: Despite all this, they continued sinning and refused to trust in his miraculous works.

verses.kjv: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.
verses.ct: So he let their days waste away in futility and their years end in disaster.

verses.kjv: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.
verses.ct: Whenever he killed some of them, the rest would come looking for him, turning back and earnestly seeking God.

verses.kjv: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.
verses.ct: They would remember that God was their rock and that the Most High God was their redeemer.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.
verses.ct: But they were just flattering him with their words; they lied to him with their tongues.

verses.kjv: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.
verses.ct: Their hearts were not truly devoted to him, and they were not faithful to his covenant.

verses.kjv: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.
verses.ct: Yet he, full of compassion, forgave their sin and did not destroy them. Over and over he held back his anger and did not unleash his full fury.

verses.kjv: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.
verses.ct: He kept in mind that they were only human — a breath of wind that passes and never returns.

verses.kjv: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!
verses.ct: How many times they defied him in the wilderness and caused him grief in the desert!

verses.kjv: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: Again and again they tested God and put limits on the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.
verses.ct: They did not remember his power or the day he rescued them from the enemy —

verses.kjv: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:
verses.ct: how he displayed his miraculous signs in Egypt and his wonders in the region of Zoan.

verses.kjv: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.
verses.ct: He turned their rivers to blood so they couldn't drink from their own streams.

verses.kjv: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.
verses.ct: He sent swarms of flies that devoured them and frogs that ruined their land.

verses.kjv: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.
verses.ct: He handed their crops over to caterpillars and the fruit of their labor to locusts.

verses.kjv: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.
verses.ct: He destroyed their grapevines with hail and their sycamore trees with frost.

verses.kjv: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
verses.ct: He subjected their cattle to hail and their livestock to bolts of lightning.

verses.kjv: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.
verses.ct: He poured out his fierce anger on them — fury, rage, and devastation — sending destroying angels among them.

verses.kjv: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;
verses.ct: He cleared a path for his anger. He did not spare their souls from death but handed their lives over to the plague.

verses.kjv: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:
verses.ct: He struck down every firstborn in Egypt — the firstfruits of their strength in the households of Ham.

verses.kjv: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
verses.ct: But he led his own people out like sheep and guided them through the wilderness like a flock.

verses.kjv: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
verses.ct: He brought them along safely so they had nothing to dread, while the sea swallowed their enemies.

verses.kjv: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.
verses.ct: He brought them to the border of his holy land, to this mountain region that his own power had secured.

verses.kjv: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
verses.ct: He drove out nations ahead of them, distributed the land to them as their inheritance, and settled the tribes of Israel in their homes.

verses.kjv: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:
verses.ct: Yet they tested and defied the Most High God and did not follow his instructions.

verses.kjv: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
verses.ct: They turned away and were unfaithful just like their ancestors; they were as unreliable as a warped bow.

verses.kjv: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
verses.ct: They provoked his anger with their pagan shrines and stirred up his jealousy with their carved idols.

verses.kjv: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:
verses.ct: When God heard about this, he was furious and completely rejected Israel.

verses.kjv: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;
verses.ct: He abandoned the tabernacle at Shiloh — the tent he had placed among his people.

verses.kjv: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.
verses.ct: He allowed the ark of his strength to be captured and handed his glory over to the enemy.

verses.kjv: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.
verses.ct: He surrendered his people to the sword; he was angry with his own inheritance.

verses.kjv: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.
verses.ct: Fire consumed their young men, and their young women had no one to marry them.

verses.kjv: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.
verses.ct: Their priests were killed by the sword, and their widows could not even weep for them.

verses.kjv: Then the LORD awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.
verses.ct: Then the Lord rose up like someone waking from sleep, like a warrior energized and shouting.

verses.kjv: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.
verses.ct: He struck his enemies from behind and put them to lasting shame.

verses.kjv: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
verses.ct: He rejected the tent of Joseph and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.

verses.kjv: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.
verses.ct: Instead, he chose the tribe of Judah — Mount Zion, which he loved.

verses.kjv: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.
verses.ct: He built his sanctuary towering like the heights, firm like the earth that he established forever.

verses.kjv: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:
verses.ct: He selected David his servant and took him from the sheep pens.

verses.kjv: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
verses.ct: From tending nursing ewes, he brought him to shepherd Jacob his people and Israel his inheritance.

verses.kjv: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
verses.ct: David shepherded them with an honest heart and led them with skillful hands.
